description: tan bird with muted yellow at top of tailfeathers, in profile from PL, on a branch; blue-green mottled background of leaves against the sky
provenance: (Michael Campbell, Tunbridge Wells, Kent, England, until 2017; sold to Kinney); Marla J. Kinney, Minneapolis (2017-18)
text: If Allen Seaby’s cuckoo has a slight feel of a scientific specimen, that’s because it was modeled after a painting he did for The British Bird Book (1910–13), a survey of bird behavior. He depicted his subject making its “cuckoo” sound, which, as the text explains, is “uttered with the bill closed, or almost so.”
title: Cuckoo
